is a small village in the
district, with a population of about______. The majority of the population are Buddhist followers.

The village can be reached from Reckong Peo, the administrative headquarters of Kinnaur district, by bus (about 25 km - three times a day). Taxi services are also available from Reckong Peo frequently as per convenience (Rs. 500). The route is Recong Peo - Thopan - Ribba Akpa and Reckong Peo and another old HT Road being widened is Via Pangi village Thopen and to Rarang via Swaden.

Rarang monastery is a popular pilgrim spot in Rarang. Located just outside the village in the Thopan side, stands this newly built monastery of Tashi Choeling. The monastery is noted for its ancient dwellings and temples which merges with the mountain from one side.
